input:
Person1:      Fixing computer isn ’ t my cup of tea . You can leave this job to Jason .  
 Person2:  Yeah , he has a good commend of computer skills . But ...  
 Person1:       But what ?  
 Person2:  But he is always talking big .

Person1:      What did you say ? 
 Person2:  I said it ’ s a lovely day . Why don't we go for a walk ? 
 Person1:       Well , I feel a little tired . 
 Person2:  Come on ! Rest breads rust . 
 Person1:       Then can you wait a few minutes ? I want to finish writing this letter . 
 Person2:  I hope it won't be too long . It would be a shame not to take advantage of such lovely weather . 
 Person1:       It won't be long . No more than ten minutes . Why don't you go ahead and I'll meet you in the park ? 
 Person2:  OK ! See you later !

Person1:      Good afternoon , Mr . Dome ’ s office .  
 Person2:  This is Denise , Mr . Bruce ’ s Secretary . I was calling to confirm his meeting tomorrow with Mr . Dome at 4 o ’ clock .  
 Person1:       Yes , it ’ s confirmed for here in our office .  
 Person2:  Is your address still 1150 Lake Road ?  
 Person1:       Yes , that ’ s correct .  
 Person2:  Ok . Thank you .
